text: In `IntervalRootFinding` , `Contractor` is an abstract type. In `IntervalConstraintProgramming` , `Contractor` is a concrete type derived from `AbstractContractor` , so I think importing and re-exporting would fail, since the types are defined differently in the two packages? Maybe a smarter fix might be to have a common abstract type `AbtractContractor` in both and then have `Bisection, Newton, Krawczyk <: AbstractContractor` in `IntervalRootFinding` and `BasicContractor, Contractor <: AbstractContractor` in `IntervalConstraintProgramming` ? Anyway, I can open an issue about this on github and we can discuss more there. In which repository would it make more sense to open it?
